name: Fuerza Regida
description:
'''Fuerza Regida''' is an American [[regional Mexican]] band formed in [[San Bernardino, California]] in 2015, initially as a [[cover band]].  They were formed by frontman Jesús Ortíz Paz, backing vocalist and 12-string guitarist Samuel Jáimez, rhythm guitarist Khrystian Ramos and sousaphone player José "Pelón" García, with tololoche player Moisés López joining the lineup in 2022. Initially known as a [[Norteño (music)|norteño]] band, they have later incorporated several subgenres onto their music, including [[corridos tumbados]], for which they are one of the pioneer groups.

In 2018, they released a song titled "Radicamos en South Central", which would receive moderate success and eventually lead to a signing of a contract with Lumbre Music, where they later issued their first full-length release, the live album ''En Vivo Puros Corridos'' (2018). Eight of Fuerza Regida's studio albums, ''[[Del Barrio Hasta Aquí]]'' (2019), ''[[Adicto (album)|Adicto]]'' (2020), ''Otro Pedo, Otro Mundo'' (2020), ''Del Barrio Hasta Aquí, Vol. 2'' (2021), ''[[Pa Que Hablen]]'' (2022), ''[[Sigan Hablando]]'' (2022), ''[[Pa Las Baby's y Belikeada]]'' (2023), and ''[[111xpantia]]'' (2025) have peaked within the top 10 of the US [[Regional Mexican Albums]] chart, with their eighth studio album ''[[Pero No Te Enamores]]'' (2024) exploring [[electronic dance music|EDM]] and other dance genres.

Some of the band's most notable songs include "[[Bebe Dame]]", "[[Ch y la Pizza]]", "[[Harley Quinn (song)|Harley Quinn]]", "[[Tú Name]]", "[[Nel (song)|Nel]]", "[[Me Jalo]]" and "[[Por Esos Ojos]]", which have appeared on the US [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] and the [[Mexico Songs]] charts and subsequently received certifications in both countries. Throughout their career, Fuerza Regida have earned four [[Billboard Music Awards|''Billboard'' Music Awards]], including two wins for [[Billboard Music Award for Top Duo/Group|Top Duo/Group]], seven [[Billboard Latin Music Awards|''Billboard'' Latin Music Awards]], and one [[Latin American Music Awards|Latin American Music Award]].
